body.name: LRONG 1PC PC Chassis Fan Hub CPU Cooling HUB Fan PWM Hub SATA Controller Speed Controller
body.stockDetail: Only 5 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 29 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: 12V 10-way 4pin SATA fan hub, to solve the problem of insufficient motherboard fan ports. The hub has 10 fan ports, can support 10 fans, can meet various host requirements, and supports 3pin/4pin fans.

Installation steps: The PWM port is connected to the CPU fan port on the motherboard. The red port is dedicated to the CPU fan. Connect 1 fan to the red portand then connect the rest of the fans. Then you need to connect the fan hub's PWM cable to the motherboard. Connect the SATA cable to the fan hub.

Equipped with PWM cable: The hub is equipped with a PWM cable with a length of 40CM, which can support the back line. After the PWM cable is connected to the main board, the temperature control and speed can be controlled by the main board.
Convenient installation: the hub is fixed with 3M glue, and the back of each hub is equipped with an American 3M glue, which can make the hub work well; Fixed in the chassis.
Package content: 1 X 12V 10-channel 4pin fan hub, 1X PWM connection cable.
body.description: Name: 10 way 4 pin SATA Fan Hub Power Interface: SATA Fan Interface: Support 3/4Pin Size: 7x4.6cm Rated Voltage: 12V Scope of Application: 4 pin interface of motherboard PWM Connection Wire Length: 40cm/15.7in Feature: PWM is connected to the motherboard FAN CPU interface through the PWM CONNECTION cable. The red interface is the specific interface of the CPU fan, and the black interface is the standard PWM fan interface. There is a double sided EVA adhesive on the back, which can fix the hub in the computer case. Note: The red port must be plugged in with a fan first. Pull one end of the PWM connector to plug the motherboard CPU_FAN interface.

reviews.reviewText: Just build a gaming pc and had more fans I my previous build. I decided to give this a try and it work just fine no problems

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I more or less expected what I received with this product. It's inexpensive, bare bones, and the quality is on the lower side. If you don't need anything fancy, it will probably do the job though. If the appearance of your system matters, or if it's cramped inside the case and short circuiting exposed pins is a concern, you'll probably want something with a plastic case over it and not this product.The first issue I had is that the connectors for the PWM and SATA power are not secured very well to the PCB. There are some tiny plastic pins that pop out with very little force on the SATA power end and then they tend to get bent/break with the stress of unplugging/plugging in the power. The power and PWM pins are soldered in well, so unless you stress it a lot, it's just an annoyance. One could always apply a couple drops of glue and that would likely solve the issue.The other issue that I had, which may depend on your hardware, is that the PWM only works on my "System 4 Pump" fan header on my Gigabyte AORUS z590 Elite Ax Wifi motherboard. The other headers have the fans running at full speed all the time. I was then able to map that header to the CPU temperature sensor in the Gigabyte software and so it ramps up all four fans in my system simultaneously, based on current CPU temps.The adhesive pad on the back may or may not be a convenience, but I just stuck it to the inside top of my case in one of the unused fan bays. If you want to mount it to a stand-off using the hole in the center, you might want to remove the adhesive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars simplify my fan setup
reviews.reviewText: Sata powered, you can plug the fan header controller to a 4 pin that you can adjust, or just unplug them to run 100% all the time. Guess it works fine with those quiet noctua fan.
